text: It was shite they killed off all the good characters and its a fkn musical do not watch
Alright, this is not too bad as they say so, is not the best intriduction to mlp universe, but is entertaining
There are parts of this movie that feel forced, but the animation, humor, and fun characters are enough to compensate.
My little Pony: A New Generation is a mostly well put together kids movie, However its inability to explain what happened between the generations, Leaves a lot to be desired.
It has absolutely nothing to do with my little pony or Equestria. It's not even in Equestria. Terrible reboot.

Shooting for the skies by hoof-horning a beloved 2010s franchise, My Little Pony: A New Generation can’t quite replicate the charm of the show that came from it, but this big-badless animated adventure should be enough to satisfy young viewers.
It was a good movie filled with comedy, music, adventures. But it was not as good as the first movie (2D)

For my first time taking the MLP franchise somewhat seriously, it was a surprisingly pleasant experience. WIth notable actors like Kimiko Glenn, James Marsden, Ken Jeong, and Vanessa Hudgens, the characters were very interesting and entertaining as well. The movie has a serviceable plot, with a few here-and-there's that could be tweaked. A hilarious, kind-hearted film with a nice little moral to wrap it up nice and tight for all families to enjoy.
I have no words. (the animation and characters suck:)

Ok, but this was horrible. I wish I could give it 0 stars. It's not the animation, or anything like that, it's the story. It's HORRIBLE. It's changed everything of the original My Little Pony. And it literally says that the ponies hated each other, even though the series already did that and solved it...  and how did Sunny turn into a alicorn so quickly? It's just a bad storyline... and it ruined my childhood. It should have been the Mane 6.
Wish I could give it 0

Honestly my kids enjoyed watching the friendship is magic version and me personally I grew up watching the original one so for them to just make a new one was outrageous and I would honestly be ok with it but they also removed the names I watched episode one with my child and she said she hated it. I dislike this new show.
The storyline is bad and it just doesn't make sense. And this is a kid's movie but it is way too cliche and cringe. Not a good movie at all.

This film, MLP: A New Generation botched the entire franchise of G4's continuation into the future, I get the concept of reuniting what once was broken hundreds of years back but it was executed so poorly, that it's offensive after years of what G4 can pull up after over a decade of its runtime as a series; just for G5 to botch up the lore of the film once again with barely any substance within. As I watched the film carefully, what I could say, is it's UNNECESSARY to make G5 look 3D, not only that, it looks extremely uncanny if you wanted to make a good G5 film, at least make the style of the film not look like it tried to copy cheap looking knock-offs from other imitators.
It has good animation, a good storyline. The only problem is the plot of the movie that messed up G4 mlp series

The movie sucks and did mlp no good. They did it DIRTY. They erase the entirety of whatever happened in the cartoon series and change it into something else entirely. Kids will still enjoy it though because they're well.. kids. But people who HAVE watched mlp before. Will not enjoy this movie.

The plot is weird and boring. Not to mention dumb and unnecessary. There isn't even a real reasoning behind it as to why all the ponies don't have their natural abilities anymore. And there's no insight as to what had happened. The movie is terrible and so is the series. Don't recommend this movie to ACTUAL fans of mlp.

I love it.
It's great movie.
La animación es increíble la protagonista nada mal los personajes secundarios decentes y el humor decente es un buen comienzo para la G5 es un 8 de 10
This fantasy adventure highlights a fun beginning for a new franchise.
